datasheets.name: Zarkys and Helskarr

damaged.description: While this model has 1–4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

datasheets.fluff: Ambitious, arrogant and filled with festering contempt, Zarkys pilots the War Dog Stalker Helskarr in aggressive fashion, guiding her monstrous steed into the heart of the enemy and annihilating her prey with fire and claw.
datasheets.loadout: ■ This model is equipped with: avenger chaincannon; havoc multi-launcher; slaughterclaw.

datasheets.name: Karthon and Firegheist

damaged.description: While this model has 1–4 wounds remaining, each time this model makes an attack, subtract 1 from the Hit roll.

datasheets.fluff: Karthon shares an exceptionally close bond of bitter hatred with his War Dog Brigand, Firegheist. With daemonbreath spear and diabolus heavy stubber, Karthon and Firegheist burn through their prey with merciless rage.
datasheets.loadout: ■ This model is equipped with: avenger chaincannon; daemonbreath spear; diabolus heavy stubber; armoured feet.

stratagems.name: Infernal Rage
stratagems.target: One WAR DOG unit from your army that has not been selected to fight this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, improve the Armour Penetration characteristic of melee weapons equipped by models in your unit by 1, add 2 to the Attacks characteristic of slaughterclaw weapons equipped by models in your unit, and add 4 to the Attacks characteristic of armoured feet weapons equipped by models in your unit.
stratagems.fluff: The feral machine spirits of War Dog warsuits complement the rabid aggression of their pilots. Both revel in falling upon their prey with a savage fury.

stratagems.name: Hunter’s Stride
stratagems.target: One WAR DOG unit from your army that has not been selected to move this phase.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, each time a model in your unit makes a move, it can move through enemy models. When doing so, it can move within Engagement Range of such models but cannot end that move within Engagement Range of them, and any Desperate Escape test is automatically passed.
stratagems.fluff: When the hunt has begun, few obstacles can turn the Slaughter Talon from its task. Its Knights propel themselves forward with loping strides, scattering enemies aside.

stratagems.name: Lunging Strike
stratagems.target: One WAR DOG unit from your army.
stratagems.effect: Until the end of the phase, your unit is eligible to declare a charge in a turn in which it Fell Back. When doing so, it must select at least one enemy unit it was not within Engagement Range of at the start of the turn to be a target of that charge.
stratagems.fluff: The Slaughter Talon’s War Dogs circle their prey, lunging in to hew away chunks of armour and flesh before darting back to strike again, toying with their victims.

enhancements.name: Frenzied to the Last
enhancements.description: WAR DOG STALKER model only. If the bearer is destroyed by a melee attack and it has not fought this phase, roll one D6: on a 2+, do not remove it from play. The destroyed model can fight after the attacking unit has finished making its attacks, and it is then removed from play. When making its attacks, the destroyed model is considered to have 1 wound remaining for the purpose of its Damaged ability.

enhancements.name: Feral Hunter
enhancements.description:
WAR DOG BRIGAND model only.

■ At the start of the Deploy Armies step, you can set the bearer up in Strategic Reserves instead of setting it up on the battlefield.
■ Each time the bearer is set up on the battlefield from Strategic Reserves, it can be set up anywhere on the battlefield wholly within 9" of one or more battlefield edges and not within 6" of one or more enemy units. When doing so, if the bearer is set up within 9" of one or more enemy units, until the end of the turn, it is not eligible to declare a charge.
